messages.content: truly a card of all time
how do you navigate a tourmaline start
I mean, I guess you can put this in the 1 cost flame barrier not really
it's good with amethyst
so if you find that you can put both in twin slam
for -4 strength and 8 thorns

Definitely feels like the worst gem. Thorns should be pretty good cause of all the multihits, but it's situational by nature. Sort of bad with twin slam, at least early cause it's hard to fit in the block
Putting this in a bauble burst would be very funny
But not practical
this is probably the best first gem for act 1
stick it in something like suspension or temporal strike
but otherwise, thorns are pretty much only supporting damage, never a damage system
I've found that brace is a good gem for act 1 because if you put it in twin slam you can enter defensive with just twin slam and curl up+
if there were more cards like <strike for strike> that utilize thorns thered be another way to use block for damage other than body crash

messages.content: Hermit 1, and IC 1 also kinda count
you don't need multihits in act 1 for tourmaline to be good in twin slam. everything has low hp so the chip damage matters a lot more.
also, thorns is good in AoE fights, which act 1 has a few of
I guess you can also interpret tourmaline as a drunk shiv?
yeah lol
shinblitz mentioned aoe fights
but act 1 is very welcoming to drunk shivs
ok I guess it's more "extremely delayed shiv"
if you spend 2 energy to play twin slam and get slammed for 26 by slimes to get 8 damage on them all you uh might not be having a fun time
much more likely you killed 1-2 slimes on turn 1
defensive mode takes away at least 10 of that damage because it can proc between their attacks
and if you're lucky with a turn 1 curl up, you have 20 block for it
or maybe a bit less since you're attacked turn 1
for 18 yes
it's not perfect but that fight is pretty harsh to begin with
extra damage in any fight is very helpful for guardian who needs the damage help
that and gremlin gang
eh i’d rather just draft more attacks in act1 usually
so would i lmao
but you get a head start with thorns and don't always get the attacks on time
thorns has consistently been my strongest act 1 gem
instant socket is necessary if you want to go burning elite act1 tho for sure
although blue guy advocating for sapphire socket into boss swap is certainly something interesting
arguably you might not be getting the thorns in time either
sapphire socket is surprisingly good
like drafting two <priming shot>-

back to usual (but a bit late) voting

I think this gem is pretty useful, especially in acts 1 and 2. In act 2 especially, knowing that you have easy, cheap access to thorns when this is socketed into something else feels great as a way to prepare for all the nasty multihitting enemies and AOE fights. Most of the time you just want 1 of these, but I could see taking the second if a deck was very good at blocking and stalling, or if your book of stabbing matchup really needed the help. It's certainly not a flashy gem, and a lot of the time it will be a delayed shiv (though guardian is so good at blocking and using defensive mode that this isn't as big of a problem as it might seem). The bigger loss is that fragmented gem generates a 0 cost attack, which has really nice synergies with several guardian cards (stasis engine,floating orbs), as well as with the ninja relics.

If you get this at the start of the run from bronze gear, or pick it up early in act 1 before a campfire, it's a useful tool to help deal damage and end the short fights against low health enemies. Guardian tends to have such a difficult time with the early game (particularly with frontloading damage) that I am quite happy to add and socket a card like this to help out. It can be a very fun socket into twin slam (8 thorns is hilarious against multihit enemies like snake plant, bosses, and book of stabbing) but is likely not optimal considering just how insane twin slam can get with more powerful gems being doubled. Depending on how hard the path you are taking in act 1 is, you may need to socket it at the first campfire anyways to avoid having a low impact, delayed skill into gremlin nob. Can be fun to play this alongside the debuff removers to keep some thorns, though definitely not as powerful as using ruby and emerald in that slot. I think it's in a pretty good spot balance wise, it's a little worse than fragmented gem in most spots as a common, but does good work as a meta call against multi-hit enemies, and can give perma thorns.
